datafu.pig.hash.lsh.interfaces

Class LSH

  • java.lang.Object
    • datafu.pig.hash.lsh.interfaces.LSH
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractStableDistributionFunction, HyperplaneLSH, RepeatingLSH

    public abstract class LSH
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class representing a locality sensitive hash. From wikipedia's article on Locality Sensitive Hashing:

    Locality-sensitive hashing (LSH) is a method of performing probabilistic dimension reduction of high-dimensional data. The basic idea is to hash the input items so that similar items are mapped to the same buckets with high probability (the number of buckets being much smaller than the universe of possible input items).

        public LSH(int dim,
           org.apache.commons.math.random.RandomGenerator rg)
        Construct a locality sensitive hash. Note, one may pass a pre-seeded generator.
        Parameters:
        dim - The dimension of the vectors which are to be hashed
        rg - The random generator to use internally.

        Hash a vector.

        Returns:
